Paquete principal del News Collector System.

Contiene los módulos funcionales del sistema: colectores, scoring, almacenamiento y utilidades.

 2Paquete principal del News Collector System.
 3
 4Contiene los módulos funcionales del sistema: colectores, scoring,
 5almacenamiento y utilidades.

class RSSCollector(src.BaseCollector): 
  59class RSSCollector(BaseCollector):
  60    """
  61    Colector especializado en feeds RSS y Atom.
  62
  63    Esta clase es como un bibliotecario especializado que conoce íntimamente
  64    el lenguaje de los feeds RSS, sabe cómo extraer la información más valiosa
  65    de cada uno, y puede adaptarse a las particularidades de diferentes fuentes.
  66
  67    Hereda de BaseCollector para mantener consistencia con otros tipos de
  68    colectores que podríamos agregar en el futuro (APIs, web scraping, etc.).
  69    """
  70
  71    def __init__(self, logger_factory: Optional["NewsCollectorLogger"] = None) -> None:
  72        super().__init__(logger_factory=logger_factory)
  73        self.db_manager = get_database_manager()
  74        self.session = self._create_session()
  75
  76        # Estadísticas de la sesión actual
  77        self.session_stats = {
  78            "sources_checked": 0,
  79            "articles_found": 0,
  80            "articles_saved": 0,
  81            "errors_encountered": 0,
  82            "start_time": datetime.now(timezone.utc),
  83        }
  84        # Per-domain rate limiting state
  85        self._domain_last_request: Dict[str, float] = {}
  86        # Robots cache per domain (timestamp, parser)
  87        self._robots_cache: Dict[str, Tuple[float, robotparser.RobotFileParser]] = {}
  88
  89    def _create_session(self) -> requests.Session:
  90        """
  91        Crea una sesión HTTP optimizada para recolección de feeds.
  92
  93        Una sesión HTTP es como tener un navegador persistente que recuerda
  94        cookies, mantiene conexiones abiertas, y puede aplicar configuraciones
  95        consistentes a todas las requests. Esto es mucho más eficiente que
  96        crear una nueva conexión para cada feed.
  97        """
  98        session = requests.Session()
  99
 100        # Headers que nos identifican como un bot legítimo y responsable
 101        session.headers.update(
 102            {
 103                "User-Agent": COLLECTION_CONFIG["user_agent"],
 104                "Accept": "application/rss+xml, application/atom+xml, application/xml, text/xml",
 105                "Accept-Language": "en-US,en;q=0.9,es;q=0.8",
 106                "Accept-Encoding": "gzip, deflate",
 107                "Cache-Control": "no-cache",
 108                "Connection": "keep-alive",
 109            }
 110        )
 111
 112        # Pooling adapter; retries handled manually for jitter control
 113        from requests.adapters import HTTPAdapter
 114
 115        adapter = HTTPAdapter(pool_connections=10, pool_maxsize=20)
 116        session.mount("http://", adapter)
 117        session.mount("https://", adapter)
 118
 119        return session
 120
 121    # Robots/TOS helpers
 122    def _get_robots(self, domain: str) -> Optional[robotparser.RobotFileParser]:
 123        if not ROBOTS_CONFIG["respect_robots"]:
 124            return None
 125        now = time.time()
 126        ttl = ROBOTS_CONFIG["cache_ttl_seconds"]
 127        cached = self._robots_cache.get(domain)
 128        if cached and (now - cached[0] < ttl):
 129            return cached[1]
 130        try:
 131            robots_url = f"https://{domain}/robots.txt"
 132            resp = httpx.get(
 133                robots_url,
 134                timeout=5.0,
 135                headers={"User-Agent": COLLECTION_CONFIG["user_agent"]},
 136            )
 137            if resp.status_code >= 400:
 138                return None
 139            rp = robotparser.RobotFileParser()
 140            rp.parse(resp.text.splitlines())
 141            self._robots_cache[domain] = (now, rp)
 142            return rp
 143        except Exception:
 144            return None
 145
 146    def _respect_robots(self, url: str) -> Tuple[bool, Optional[float]]:
 147        if not ROBOTS_CONFIG["respect_robots"]:
 148            return (True, None)
 149        domain = urlparse(url).netloc
 150        rp = self._get_robots(domain)
 151        if not rp:
 152            return (True, None)
 153        ua = COLLECTION_CONFIG["user_agent"]
 154        try:
 155            allowed = rp.can_fetch(ua, url)
 156        except Exception:
 157            allowed = True
 158        try:
 159            delay = rp.crawl_delay(ua)
 160        except Exception:
 161            delay = None
 162        return (allowed, delay)
 163
 164    # Per-domain rate limiting with robots.txt crawl-delay
 165    def _enforce_domain_rate_limit(
 166        self,
 167        domain: str,
 168        robots_delay: Optional[float] = None,
 169        source_min_delay: Optional[float] = None,
 170    ):
 171        now = time.time()
 172        last = self._domain_last_request.get(domain, 0.0)
 173        effective_delay = calculate_effective_delay(
 174            domain, robots_delay, source_min_delay
 175        )
 176        jitter = random.uniform(0, RATE_LIMITING_CONFIG.get("jitter_max", 0.3))
 177        wait = (last + effective_delay + jitter) - now
 178        if wait > 0:
 179            time.sleep(wait)
 180        self._domain_last_request[domain] = time.time()
 181
 182    def _backoff_sleep(self, attempt: int):
 183        base = RATE_LIMITING_CONFIG.get("backoff_base", 0.5)
 184        max_b = RATE_LIMITING_CONFIG.get("backoff_max", 10.0)
 185        jitter = random.uniform(0, RATE_LIMITING_CONFIG.get("jitter_max", 0.3))
 186        delay = min(max_b, (base * (2**attempt)) + jitter)
 187        time.sleep(delay)
 188
 189    def collect_from_source(
 190        self, source_id: str, source_config: Dict[str, Any]
 191    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 192        """
 193        Recopila artículos de una fuente RSS específica.
 194
 195        Este método es como enviar a nuestro explorador a una biblioteca específica
 196        con instrucciones precisas sobre qué tipo de libros buscar y cómo traerlos
 197        de vuelta de manera organizada.
 198
 199        Args:
 200            source_id: Identificador único de la fuente
 201            source_config: Configuración completa de la fuente
 202
 203        Returns:
 204            Diccionario con estadísticas de la recolección
 205        """
 206        start_time = time.time()
 207        stats = {
 208            "source_id": source_id,
 209            "success": False,
 210            "articles_found": 0,
 211            "articles_saved": 0,
 212            "error_message": None,
 213            "processing_time": 0,
 214        }
 215
 216        try:
 217            job_key = self._make_job_key(source_id, source_config["url"])
 218            if self._is_duplicate_job(job_key):
 219                self._emit_log(
 220                    "info",
 221                    "collector.job.duplicate",
 222                    source_id=source_id,
 223                    details={"url": source_config.get("url")},
 224                )
 225                stats["success"] = True
 226                return stats
 227
 228            self._register_job(job_key)
 229            self._emit_log(
 230                "info",
 231                "collector.fetch.start",
 232                source_id=source_id,
 233                details={
 234                    "source_name": source_config.get("name"),
 235                    "url": source_config.get("url"),
 236                },
 237            )
 238
 239            allowed, robots_delay = self._respect_robots(source_config["url"])
 240            if not allowed:
 241                stats["error_message"] = "Bloqueado por robots.txt"
 242                self._emit_log(
 243                    "warning",
 244                    "collector.fetch.blocked_robots",
 245                    source_id=source_id,
 246                    details={"url": source_config.get("url")},
 247                )
 248                self._send_to_dlq(source_id, source_config["url"], "robots_disallowed")
 249                return stats
 250
 251            domain = urlparse(source_config["url"]).netloc
 252            self._enforce_domain_rate_limit(
 253                domain, robots_delay, source_config.get("min_delay_seconds")
 254            )
 255
 256            feed_content, status_code = self._fetch_feed(
 257                source_id, source_config["url"]
 258            )
 259            if status_code == 304:
 260                self._emit_log(
 261                    "info",
 262                    "collector.feed.not_modified",
 263                    source_id=source_id,
 264                    details={"status_code": status_code},
 265                )
 266                stats["success"] = True
 267                return stats
 268
 269            if not feed_content:
 270                stats["error_message"] = "No se pudo obtener el feed"
 271                self._emit_log(
 272                    "warning",
 273                    "collector.feed.unavailable",
 274                    source_id=source_id,
 275                    details={
 276                        "status_code": status_code,
 277                        "url": source_config.get("url"),
 278                    },
 279                )
 280                return stats
 281
 282            parsed_feed = feedparser.parse(feed_content)
 283
 284            if parsed_feed.bozo and not self._is_acceptable_bozo(parsed_feed):
 285                stats["error_message"] = (
 286                    f"Feed malformado: {parsed_feed.bozo_exception}"
 287                )
 288                self._emit_log(
 289                    "warning",
 290                    "collector.feed.malformed",
 291                    source_id=source_id,
 292                    details={"error": str(parsed_feed.bozo_exception)},
 293                )
 294                return stats
 295
 296            try:
 297                raw_articles = self._extract_articles_from_feed(
 298                    parsed_feed, source_config, source_id
 299                )
 300            except TypeError:
 301                raw_articles = self._extract_articles_from_feed(  # type: ignore[misc]
 302                    parsed_feed, source_config  # backwards compatibility for overrides
 303                )
 304            stats["articles_found"] = len(raw_articles)
 305
 306            if not raw_articles:
 307                self._emit_log(
 308                    "info",
 309                    "collector.feed.empty",
 310                    source_id=source_id,
 311                    details={"url": source_config.get("url")},
 312                )
 313                stats["success"] = True
 314                return stats
 315
 316            saved_count = 0
 317            for raw_article in raw_articles:
 318                try:
 319                    processed_article = self._process_article(
 320                        raw_article, source_id, source_config
 321                    )
 322                    if processed_article and self._save_article(processed_article):
 323                        saved_count += 1
 324                except Exception as exc:
 325                    self._emit_log(
 326                        "error",
 327                        "collector.article.process_error",
 328                        source_id=source_id,
 329                        details={
 330                            "error": str(exc),
 331                            "url": raw_article.get("link")
 332                            or raw_article.get("id")
 333                            or raw_article.get("url"),
 334                        },
 335                    )
 336                    self.session_stats["errors_encountered"] += 1
 337
 338            stats["articles_saved"] = saved_count
 339            stats["success"] = True
 340
 341            elapsed = time.time() - start_time
 342            self._emit_log(
 343                "info",
 344                "collector.fetch.completed",
 345                source_id=source_id,
 346                latency=elapsed,
 347                details={
 348                    "articles_found": len(raw_articles),
 349                    "articles_saved": saved_count,
 350                },
 351            )
 352
 353        except requests.RequestException as exc:
 354            stats["error_message"] = f"Error de red: {exc}"
 355            self._emit_log(
 356                "error",
 357                "collector.fetch.network_error",
 358                source_id=source_id,
 359                details={"error": str(exc), "url": source_config.get("url")},
 360            )
 361
 362        except Exception as exc:
 363            stats["error_message"] = f"Error inesperado: {exc}"
 364            self._emit_log(
 365                "error",
 366                "collector.fetch.unexpected_error",
 367                source_id=source_id,
 368                details={"error": str(exc)},
 369            )
 370
 371        finally:
 372            stats["processing_time"] = time.time() - start_time
 373            self._update_source_stats(source_id, stats)
 374            self.session_stats["sources_checked"] += 1
 375            self.session_stats["articles_found"] += stats["articles_found"]
 376            self.session_stats["articles_saved"] += stats["articles_saved"]
 377
 378        return stats
 379
 380    def _fetch_feed(
 381        self, source_id: str, feed_url: str
 382    ) -> Tuple[Optional[str], Optional[int]]:
 383        """
 384        Obtiene el contenido de un feed RSS de manera robusta.
 385
 386        Este método es como tener un mensajero muy experimentado que sabe
 387        cómo manejar todas las complicaciones que pueden surgir al contactar
 388        diferentes servidores: redirects, timeouts, servidores lentos, etc.
 389        """
 390        try:
 391            max_retries = RATE_LIMITING_CONFIG["max_retries"]
 392            cached_headers: Dict[str, Optional[str]] = {
 393                "etag": None,
 394                "last_modified": None,
 395            }
 396            try:
 397                cached_headers = self.db_manager.get_source_feed_metadata(source_id)
 398            except Exception as metadata_error:
 399                self._emit_log(
 400                    "warning",
 401                    "collector.feed.metadata_lookup_failed",
 402                    source_id=source_id,
 403                    details={"error": str(metadata_error)},
 404                )
 405            for attempt in range(0, max_retries + 1):
 406                try:
 407                    conditional_headers = {}
 408                    if cached_headers.get("etag"):
 409                        conditional_headers["If-None-Match"] = cached_headers["etag"]
 410                    if cached_headers.get("last_modified"):
 411                        conditional_headers["If-Modified-Since"] = cached_headers[
 412                            "last_modified"
 413                        ]
 414
 415                    response = self.session.get(
 416                        feed_url,
 417                        timeout=COLLECTION_CONFIG["request_timeout"],
 418                        headers=conditional_headers or None,
 419                    )
 420                    if response.status_code in (429, 500, 502, 503, 504):
 421                        if attempt < max_retries:
 422                            self._backoff_sleep(attempt)
 423                            continue
 424                        self._emit_log(
 425                            "warning",
 426                            "collector.feed.status_retry_exhausted",
 427                            source_id=source_id,
 428                            details={
 429                                "status_code": response.status_code,
 430                                "url": feed_url,
 431                            },
 432                        )
 433                        return (None, response.status_code)
 434
 435                    if response.status_code == 304:
 436                        if response.headers.get("ETag") or response.headers.get(
 437                            "Last-Modified"
 438                        ):
 439                            try:
 440                                self.db_manager.update_source_feed_metadata(
 441                                    source_id,
 442                                    etag=response.headers.get("ETag"),
 443                                    last_modified=response.headers.get("Last-Modified"),
 444                                )
 445                            except Exception as update_error:
 446                                self._emit_log(
 447                                    "warning",
 448                                    "collector.feed.metadata_update_failed",
 449                                    source_id=source_id,
 450                                    details={
 451                                        "error": str(update_error),
 452                                        "status_code": 304,
 453                                    },
 454                                )
 455                        return (None, 304)
 456                    response.raise_for_status()
 457                    # Verificar que el contenido sea XML válido
 458                    content_type = response.headers.get("content-type", "").lower()
 459                    if not any(
 460                        xml_type in content_type for xml_type in ["xml", "rss", "atom"]
 461                    ):
 462                        self._emit_log(
 463                            "warning",
 464                            "collector.feed.suspicious_content_type",
 465                            source_id=source_id,
 466                            details={
 467                                "content_type": content_type,
 468                                "url": feed_url,
 469                            },
 470                        )
 471                    # Verificar tamaño razonable (protección contra feeds gigantes)
 472                    content_length = len(response.content)
 473                    if content_length > 10 * 1024 * 1024:  # 10MB límite
 474                        self._emit_log(
 475                            "warning",
 476                            "collector.feed.too_large",
 477                            source_id=source_id,
 478                            details={"bytes": content_length, "url": feed_url},
 479                        )
 480                        return (None, response.status_code)
 481
 482                    if response.headers.get("ETag") or response.headers.get(
 483                        "Last-Modified"
 484                    ):
 485                        try:
 486                            self.db_manager.update_source_feed_metadata(
 487                                source_id,
 488                                etag=response.headers.get("ETag"),
 489                                last_modified=response.headers.get("Last-Modified"),
 490                            )
 491                        except Exception as update_error:
 492                            self._emit_log(
 493                                "warning",
 494                                "collector.feed.metadata_update_failed",
 495                                source_id=source_id,
 496                                details={
 497                                    "error": str(update_error),
 498                                    "status_code": response.status_code,
 499                                },
 500                            )
 501
 502                    return (response.text, response.status_code)
 503                except (
 504                    requests.exceptions.Timeout,
 505                    requests.exceptions.ConnectionError,
 506                ) as re:
 507                    if attempt < max_retries:
 508                        self._backoff_sleep(attempt)
 509                        continue
 510                    self._emit_log(
 511                        "warning",
 512                        "collector.feed.retry_exhausted",
 513                        source_id=source_id,
 514                        details={"error": str(re), "url": feed_url},
 515                    )
 516                    return (None, None)
 517                except requests.exceptions.TooManyRedirects:
 518                    self._emit_log(
 519                        "warning",
 520                        "collector.feed.redirect_loop",
 521                        source_id=source_id,
 522                        details={"url": feed_url},
 523                    )
 524                    return (None, None)
 525            return (None, None)
 526        except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
 527            self._emit_log(
 528                "error",
 529                "collector.feed.fetch_exception",
 530                source_id=source_id,
 531                details={"error": str(e), "url": feed_url},
 532            )
 533            return (None, None)
 534
 535    def _is_acceptable_bozo(self, parsed_feed) -> bool:
 536        """
 537        Determina si un feed "bozo" (malformado) es aceptable para procesar.
 538
 539        feedparser marca muchos feeds como "bozo" por pequeñas imperfecciones
 540        que no impiden extraer información útil. Este método es como tener
 541        un experto que puede distinguir entre errores menores y problemas graves.
 542        """
 543        if not parsed_feed.bozo:
 544            return True
 545
 546        # Excepciones que podemos tolerar
 547        acceptable_exceptions = [
 548            "InvalidDocument",  # Documentos con pequeños errores de formato
 549            "UndeclaredNamespace",  # Namespaces no declarados pero manejables
 550        ]
 551
 552        exception_name = parsed_feed.bozo_exception.__class__.__name__
 553        return exception_name in acceptable_exceptions
 554
 555    def _extract_articles_from_feed(
 556        self,
 557        parsed_feed,
 558        source_config: Dict[str, Any],
 559        source_id: str,
 560    ) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
 561        """
 562        Extrae artículos individuales de un feed parseado.
 563
 564        Este método es como tener un bibliotecario experto que puede leer
 565        diferentes estilos de catálogos (RSS, Atom, diferentes versiones)
 566        y extraer la información esencial de cada libro de manera consistente.
 567        """
 568        articles = []
 569        max_articles = COLLECTION_CONFIG["max_articles_per_source"]
 570        recent_threshold = datetime.now(timezone.utc) - timedelta(
 571            days=COLLECTION_CONFIG["recent_days_threshold"]
 572        )
 573
 574        # Procesar entradas del feed
 575        for entry in parsed_feed.entries[:max_articles]:
 576            try:
 577                # Extraer fecha de publicación
 578                pub_dt, pub_off_min, pub_tz_name = self._extract_publication_timestamp(
 579                    entry
 580                )
 581
 582                # Filtrar artículos muy antiguos (opcional, según configuración)
 583                if pub_dt and pub_dt < recent_threshold:
 584                    continue
 585
 586                # Extraer información básica
 587                original_url = entry.get("link", "")
 588                canonical_url = canonicalize_url(original_url)
 589
 590                article_data = {
 591                    "title": self._clean_text(entry.get("title", "Sin título")),
 592                    "url": canonical_url,
 593                    "summary": self._extract_summary(entry),
 594                    "published_date": pub_dt,
 595                    "published_tz_offset_minutes": pub_off_min,
 596                    "published_tz_name": pub_tz_name,
 597                    "authors": self._extract_authors(entry),
 598                    "category": source_config["category"],
 599                    "source_metadata": self._extract_source_metadata(
 600                        entry, parsed_feed
 601                    ),
 602                    "original_url": original_url,
 603                }
 604
 605                # Validar que tengamos información mínima necesaria
 606                if self._validate_article_data(article_data):
 607                    articles.append(article_data)
 608
 609            except Exception as exc:
 610                self._emit_log(
 611                    "warning",
 612                    "collector.article.extract_failed",
 613                    source_id=source_id,
 614                    details={
 615                        "error": str(exc),
 616                        "url": entry.get("link"),
 617                    },
 618                )
 619                continue
 620
 621        return articles
 622
 623    def _extract_publication_timestamp(self, entry) -> Tuple[datetime, int, str]:
 624        """
 625        Extrae la fecha de publicación de manera robusta.
 626
 627        Las fechas en RSS son notoriamente inconsistentes. Este método
 628        es como tener un traductor que entiende todos los dialectos posibles
 629        de cómo se puede expresar una fecha.
 630        """
 631        from src.utils.datetime_utils import parse_to_utc_with_tzinfo
 632
 633        date_fields = ["published_parsed", "updated_parsed", "published", "updated"]
 634        for field in date_fields:
 635            if hasattr(entry, field):
 636                date_value = getattr(entry, field)
 637                if date_value:
 638                    try:
 639                        return parse_to_utc_with_tzinfo(date_value)
 640                    except Exception as exc:
 641                        self._emit_log(
 642                            "debug",
 643                            "collector.article.timestamp_parse_failed",
 644                            details={
 645                                "field": field,
 646                                "value": str(date_value),
 647                                "error": str(exc),
 648                            },
 649                        )
 650                        continue
 651        # Fallback: now in UTC
 652        dt, off, name = parse_to_utc_with_tzinfo(None)
 653        return dt, off, name
 654
 655    def _extract_summary(self, entry) -> str:
 656        """
 657        Extrae y limpia el resumen del artículo.
 658
 659        Los feeds RSS pueden tener el contenido en varios campos y formatos.
 660        Este método es como tener un editor que sabe encontrar la esencia
 661        del artículo sin importar cómo esté formateado.
 662        """
 663        # Campos posibles para el contenido
 664        content_fields = ["summary", "description", "content"]
 665
 666        for field in content_fields:
 667            if hasattr(entry, field):
 668                content = getattr(entry, field)
 669
 670                # Manejar diferentes formatos de contenido
 671                if isinstance(content, list) and content:
 672                    content = (
 673                        content[0].get("value", "")
 674                        if isinstance(content[0], dict)
 675                        else str(content[0])
 676                    )
 677                elif isinstance(content, dict):
 678                    content = content.get("value", "")
 679
 680                if content and isinstance(content, str):
 681                    # Limpiar HTML si existe
 682                    cleaned_content = self._clean_html(content)
 683                    if (
 684                        len(cleaned_content)
 685                        >= TEXT_PROCESSING_CONFIG["min_content_length"]
 686                    ):
 687                        return cleaned_content
 688
 689        return ""
 690
 691    def _clean_html(self, html_content: str) -> str:
 692        """
 693        Limpia contenido HTML para obtener texto plano.
 694
 695        Muchos feeds incluyen HTML en sus descripciones. Este método
 696        es como tener un filtro inteligente que mantiene la información
 697        importante pero elimina por completo el formato innecesario.
 698        """
 699        if not html_content:
 700            return ""
 701
 702        try:
 703            from src.utils.text_cleaner import clean_html as _clean
 704
 705            return _clean(html_content)
 706        except Exception as exc:
 707            self._emit_log(
 708                "warning",
 709                "collector.article.html_cleanup_failed",
 710                details={"error": str(exc)},
 711            )
 712            import re
 713
 714            text = re.sub("<[^<]+?>", "", html_content)
 715            return " ".join(text.split())
 716
 717    def _extract_authors(self, entry) -> List[str]:
 718        """
 719        Extrae información de autores cuando está disponible.
 720
 721        La información de autores en feeds RSS es muy inconsistente.
 722        Este método hace lo mejor posible para extraer esta información
 723        valiosa cuando está presente.
 724        """
 725        authors = []
 726
 727        # Campos posibles para autores
 728        if hasattr(entry, "author") and entry.author:
 729            authors.append(self._clean_text(entry.author))
 730
 731        if hasattr(entry, "authors") and entry.authors:
 732            for author in entry.authors:
 733                if isinstance(author, dict):
 734                    name = author.get("name") or author.get("email", "")
 735                else:
 736                    name = str(author)
 737
 738                if name:
 739                    authors.append(self._clean_text(name))
 740
 741        # Buscar autores en tags personalizados (para algunos journals)
 742        if hasattr(entry, "tags"):
 743            for tag in entry.tags:
 744                if "author" in tag.get("term", "").lower():
 745                    authors.append(self._clean_text(tag.get("term", "")))
 746
 747        return list(set(authors))  # Remover duplicados
 748
 749    def _extract_source_metadata(self, entry, parsed_feed) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 750        """
 751        Extrae metadatos específicos de la fuente.
 752
 753        Diferentes fuentes incluyen información especializada en sus feeds.
 754        Este método es como tener un detective que puede encontrar pistas
 755        valiosas específicas de cada tipo de fuente.
 756        """
 757        metadata = {}
 758
 759        # DOI (muy importante para papers académicos)
 760        doi = self._extract_doi(entry)
 761        if doi:
 762            metadata["doi"] = doi
 763
 764        # Tags/categorías
 765        if hasattr(entry, "tags") and entry.tags:
 766            metadata["tags"] = [
 767                tag.get("term", "") for tag in entry.tags if tag.get("term")
 768            ]
 769
 770        # Información del journal/revista
 771        if hasattr(parsed_feed, "feed"):
 772            feed_info = parsed_feed.feed
 773            if hasattr(feed_info, "title"):
 774                metadata["feed_title"] = feed_info.title
 775
 776        # Enlaces adicionales
 777        if hasattr(entry, "links") and entry.links:
 778            metadata["additional_links"] = [
 779                {"href": link.get("href"), "type": link.get("type", "unknown")}
 780                for link in entry.links
 781                if link.get("href")
 782            ]
 783
 784        # ID único del entry (útil para tracking)
 785        if hasattr(entry, "id") and entry.id:
 786            metadata["entry_id"] = entry.id
 787
 788        return metadata
 789
 790    def _extract_doi(self, entry) -> Optional[str]:
 791        """
 792        Extrae DOI (Digital Object Identifier) cuando está disponible.
 793
 794        Los DOIs son cruciales para artículos académicos porque proporcionan
 795        un enlace permanente al paper original. Este método busca DOIs
 796        en varios lugares donde pueden aparecer en feeds académicos.
 797        """
 798        import re
 799
 800        doi_pattern = r"10\.\d{4,}/[-._;()/:\w\[\]]+[^.\s]"
 801
 802        # Buscar en diferentes campos
 803        search_fields = []
 804
 805        if hasattr(entry, "id"):
 806            search_fields.append(entry.id)
 807
 808        if hasattr(entry, "summary"):
 809            search_fields.append(entry.summary)
 810
 811        if hasattr(entry, "links"):
 812            for link in entry.links:
 813                if link.get("href"):
 814                    search_fields.append(link["href"])
 815
 816        # Buscar patrón DOI en todos los campos
 817        for field in search_fields:
 818            if field and isinstance(field, str):
 819                match = re.search(doi_pattern, field, re.IGNORECASE)
 820                if match:
 821                    return match.group()
 822
 823        return None
 824
 825    def _process_article(
 826        self, raw_article: Dict[str, Any], source_id: str, source_config: Dict[str, Any]
 827    ) -> Optional[CollectorArticleModel]:
 828        """
 829        Procesa un artículo crudo para prepararlo para almacenamiento.
 830
 831        Este método es como tener un editor experto que toma información
 832        en bruto y la transforma en un formato estándar, enriquecido
 833        y listo para análisis posterior.
 834        """
 835        try:
 836            # Validaciones básicas
 837            if not raw_article.get("url") or not raw_article.get("title"):
 838                return None
 839
 840            # Crear estructura estándar del artículo
 841            processed_article = {
 842                "url": raw_article["url"],
 843                "title": raw_article["title"][:500],  # Limitar longitud del título
 844                "summary": raw_article.get("summary", "")[:2000],  # Limitar resumen
 845                "source_id": source_id,
 846                "source_name": source_config["name"],
 847                "category": source_config["category"],
 848                "published_date": raw_article.get("published_date"),
 849                "published_tz_offset_minutes": raw_article.get(
 850                    "published_tz_offset_minutes"
 851                ),
 852                "published_tz_name": raw_article.get("published_tz_name"),
 853                "authors": raw_article.get("authors", []),
 854                "language": "en",  # será recalculado abajo
 855                "is_preprint": source_config.get("special_handling") == "preprint",
 856                "article_metadata": {
 857                    "source_metadata": raw_article.get("source_metadata", {}),
 858                    "credibility_score": source_config["credibility_score"],
 859                    "processing_timestamp": datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat(),
 860                    "original_url": raw_article.get("original_url", raw_article["url"]),
 861                },
 862            }
 863
 864            # Extraer DOI si está disponible
 865            if raw_article.get("source_metadata", {}).get("doi"):
 866                processed_article["doi"] = raw_article["source_metadata"]["doi"]
 867
 868            # Determinar journal si es posible
 869            feed_title = raw_article.get("source_metadata", {}).get("feed_title")
 870            if feed_title:
 871                processed_article["journal"] = feed_title
 872
 873            # Calcular estadísticas básicas del texto
 874            content_for_stats = (
 875                f"{processed_article['title']} {processed_article['summary']}"
 876            )
 877            processed_article["word_count"] = len(content_for_stats.split())
 878            processed_article["reading_time_minutes"] = max(
 879                1, processed_article["word_count"] // 200
 880            )
 881
 882            # Detección simple de idioma (determinística)
 883            try:
 884                from src.utils.text_cleaner import detect_language_simple
 885
 886                processed_article["language"] = detect_language_simple(
 887                    content_for_stats
 888                )
 889            except Exception:
 890                processed_article["language"] = "en"
 891
 892            # Enrichment pipeline (deterministic with caching)
 893            try:
 894                enrichment = enrichment_pipeline.enrich_article(
 895                    {
 896                        "title": processed_article["title"],
 897                        "summary": processed_article["summary"],
 898                        "content": raw_article.get("source_metadata", {}).get(
 899                            "content", ""
 900                        ),
 901                        "language": processed_article["language"],
 902                    }
 903                )
 904                processed_article["article_metadata"]["enrichment"] = enrichment
 905                processed_article["language"] = enrichment["language"]
 906            except Exception as exc:  # pragma: no cover - enrichment should not fail
 907                self._emit_log(
 908                    "warning",
 909                    "collector.article.enrichment_failed",
 910                    source_id=source_id,
 911                    details={
 912                        "error": str(exc),
 913                        "url": raw_article.get("url"),
 914                    },
 915                )
 916
 917            try:
 918                return CollectorArticleModel.model_validate(processed_article)
 919            except ValidationError as exc:
 920                self._emit_log(
 921                    "warning",
 922                    "collector.article.validation_failed",
 923                    source_id=source_id,
 924                    details={
 925                        "error": str(exc),
 926                        "url": raw_article.get("url", "unknown"),
 927                    },
 928                )
 929                self._send_to_dlq(
 930                    source_id,
 931                    raw_article.get("original_url", raw_article.get("url", "")),
 932                    "collector_payload_invalid",
 933                )
 934                return None
 935
 936        except Exception as exc:
 937            self._emit_log(
 938                "error",
 939                "collector.article.process_exception",
 940                source_id=source_id,
 941                details={
 942                    "error": str(exc),
 943                    "title": raw_article.get("title"),
 944                    "url": raw_article.get("url"),
 945                },
 946            )
 947            return None
 948
 949    def _save_article(
 950        self, article_data: CollectorArticleModel | Dict[str, Any]
 951    ) -> bool:
 952        """
 953        Guarda un artículo procesado en la base de datos.
 954
 955        Este método es como tener un archivista meticuloso que verifica
 956        que no tengamos duplicados antes de agregar cada nuevo documento
 957        a nuestra colección.
 958        """
 959        if isinstance(article_data, CollectorArticleModel):
 960            title = article_data.title
 961            source_id = article_data.source_id
 962            url_value = str(article_data.url)
 963        else:
 964            title = article_data.get("title", "sin título")
 965            source_id = article_data.get("source_id")
 966            url_value = article_data.get("url")
 967
 968        try:
 969            saved_article = self.db_manager.save_article(article_data)
 970            if saved_article:
 971                self._emit_log(
 972                    "info",
 973                    "collector.article.saved",
 974                    source_id=source_id,
 975                    article_id=getattr(saved_article, "id", None),
 976                    details={
 977                        "title": title[:120],
 978                        "url": getattr(saved_article, "url", url_value),
 979                    },
 980                )
 981                return True
 982
 983            self._emit_log(
 984                "debug",
 985                "collector.article.duplicate",
 986                source_id=source_id,
 987                details={"title": title[:120], "url": url_value},
 988            )
 989            return False
 990
 991        except ValueError as exc:
 992            self._emit_log(
 993                "error",
 994                "collector.article.save_validation_error",
 995                source_id=source_id,
 996                details={"error": str(exc), "title": title[:120]},
 997            )
 998            return False
 999        except Exception as exc:
1000            self._emit_log(
1001                "error",
1002                "collector.article.save_exception",
1003                source_id=source_id,
1004                details={"error": str(exc), "title": title[:120]},
1005            )
1006            return False
1007
1008    def _update_source_stats(self, source_id: str, stats: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
1009        """
1010        Actualiza las estadísticas de una fuente después de la recolección.
1011
1012        Este método mantiene un registro detallado del performance de cada
1013        fuente, como mantener un expediente de cada proveedor de libros.
1014        """
1015        try:
1016            self.db_manager.update_source_stats(source_id, stats)
1017        except Exception as exc:
1018            self._emit_log(
1019                "error",
1020                "collector.source.stats_update_failed",
1021                source_id=source_id,
1022                details={"error": str(exc)},
1023            )
1024
1025    def _validate_article_data(self, article_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
1026        """
1027        Valida que un artículo tenga la información mínima necesaria.
1028
1029        Este método es como un control de calidad que asegura que solo
1030        artículos con información suficiente pasen al siguiente paso.
1031        """
1032        # Verificaciones básicas
1033        if not article_data.get("title") or len(article_data["title"].strip()) < 10:
1034            return False
1035
1036        if not article_data.get("url") or not article_data["url"].startswith("http"):
1037            return False
1038
1039        # Verificar que el contenido no sea demasiado corto
1040        summary = article_data.get("summary", "")
1041        if len(summary) < TEXT_PROCESSING_CONFIG["min_content_length"]:
1042            return False
1043
1044        # Verificar que no sea spam o clickbait obvio
1045        title_lower = article_data["title"].lower()
1046        penalty_keywords = TEXT_PROCESSING_CONFIG["penalty_keywords"]
1047
1048        if any(keyword.lower() in title_lower for keyword in penalty_keywords):
1049            self._emit_log(
1050                "debug",
1051                "collector.article.penalty_keyword_rejected",
1052                source_id=article_data.get("source_id"),
1053                details={"title": article_data["title"]},
1054            )
1055            return False
1056
1057        return True
1058
1059    def _clean_text(self, text: str) -> str:
1060        """
1061        Limpia y normaliza texto de manera consistente.
1062
1063        Este método es como tener un editor que aplica reglas de estilo
1064        consistentes a cada texto que procesamos.
1065        """
1066        if not text:
1067            return ""
1068
1069        from src.utils.text_cleaner import normalize_text
1070
1071        return normalize_text(text)
1072
1073    def get_session_stats(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1074        """
1075        Obtiene estadísticas de la sesión actual de recolección.
1076
1077        Este método es como obtener un reporte de actividad de nuestro
1078        explorador después de una expedición completa.
1079        """
1080        current_time = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
1081        session_duration = current_time - self.session_stats["start_time"]
1082
1083        return {
1084            **self.session_stats,
1085            "session_duration_minutes": session_duration.total_seconds() / 60,
1086            "articles_per_minute": self.session_stats["articles_found"]
1087            / max(session_duration.total_seconds() / 60, 1),
1088            "success_rate": (
1089                self.session_stats["articles_saved"]
1090                / max(self.session_stats["articles_found"], 1)
1091            )
1092            * 100,
1093            "end_time": current_time.isoformat(),
1094        }

Colector especializado en feeds RSS y Atom.

Esta clase es como un bibliotecario especializado que conoce íntimamente el lenguaje de los feeds RSS, sabe cómo extraer la información más valiosa de cada uno, y puede adaptarse a las particularidades de diferentes fuentes.

Hereda de BaseCollector para mantener consistencia con otros tipos de colectores que podríamos agregar en el futuro (APIs, web scraping, etc.).

RSSCollector( logger_factory: Optional[src.utils.logger.NewsCollectorLogger] = None) 
71    def __init__(self, logger_factory: Optional["NewsCollectorLogger"] = None) -> None:
72        super().__init__(logger_factory=logger_factory)

74        self.session = self._create_session()

79            "articles_found": 0,
80            "articles_saved": 0,

86        # Robots cache per domain (timestamp, parser)

def collect_from_source(self, source_id: str, source_config: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
189    def collect_from_source(
190        self, source_id: str, source_config: Dict[str, Any]
191    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
192        """
193        Recopila artículos de una fuente RSS específica.
194
195        Este método es como enviar a nuestro explorador a una biblioteca específica
196        con instrucciones precisas sobre qué tipo de libros buscar y cómo traerlos
197        de vuelta de manera organizada.
198
199        Args:
200            source_id: Identificador único de la fuente
201            source_config: Configuración completa de la fuente
202
203        Returns:
204            Diccionario con estadísticas de la recolección
205        """
206        start_time = time.time()
207        stats = {
208            "source_id": source_id,
209            "success": False,
210            "articles_found": 0,
211            "articles_saved": 0,
212            "error_message": None,
213            "processing_time": 0,
214        }
215
216        try:
217            job_key = self._make_job_key(source_id, source_config["url"])
218            if self._is_duplicate_job(job_key):
219                self._emit_log(
220                    "info",
221                    "collector.job.duplicate",
222                    source_id=source_id,
223                    details={"url": source_config.get("url")},
224                )
225                stats["success"] = True
226                return stats
227
228            self._register_job(job_key)
229            self._emit_log(
230                "info",
231                "collector.fetch.start",
232                source_id=source_id,
233                details={
234                    "source_name": source_config.get("name"),
235                    "url": source_config.get("url"),
236                },
237            )
238
239            allowed, robots_delay = self._respect_robots(source_config["url"])
240            if not allowed:
241                stats["error_message"] = "Bloqueado por robots.txt"
242                self._emit_log(
243                    "warning",
244                    "collector.fetch.blocked_robots",
245                    source_id=source_id,
246                    details={"url": source_config.get("url")},
247                )
248                self._send_to_dlq(source_id, source_config["url"], "robots_disallowed")
249                return stats
250
251            domain = urlparse(source_config["url"]).netloc
252            self._enforce_domain_rate_limit(
253                domain, robots_delay, source_config.get("min_delay_seconds")
254            )
255
256            feed_content, status_code = self._fetch_feed(
257                source_id, source_config["url"]
258            )
259            if status_code == 304:
260                self._emit_log(
261                    "info",
262                    "collector.feed.not_modified",
263                    source_id=source_id,
264                    details={"status_code": status_code},
265                )
266                stats["success"] = True
267                return stats
268
269            if not feed_content:
270                stats["error_message"] = "No se pudo obtener el feed"
271                self._emit_log(
272                    "warning",
273                    "collector.feed.unavailable",
274                    source_id=source_id,
275                    details={
276                        "status_code": status_code,
277                        "url": source_config.get("url"),
278                    },
279                )
280                return stats
281
282            parsed_feed = feedparser.parse(feed_content)
283
284            if parsed_feed.bozo and not self._is_acceptable_bozo(parsed_feed):
285                stats["error_message"] = (
286                    f"Feed malformado: {parsed_feed.bozo_exception}"
287                )
288                self._emit_log(
289                    "warning",
290                    "collector.feed.malformed",
291                    source_id=source_id,
292                    details={"error": str(parsed_feed.bozo_exception)},
293                )
294                return stats
295
296            try:
297                raw_articles = self._extract_articles_from_feed(
298                    parsed_feed, source_config, source_id
299                )
300            except TypeError:
301                raw_articles = self._extract_articles_from_feed(  # type: ignore[misc]
302                    parsed_feed, source_config  # backwards compatibility for overrides
303                )
304            stats["articles_found"] = len(raw_articles)
305
306            if not raw_articles:
307                self._emit_log(
308                    "info",
309                    "collector.feed.empty",
310                    source_id=source_id,
311                    details={"url": source_config.get("url")},
312                )
313                stats["success"] = True
314                return stats
315
316            saved_count = 0
317            for raw_article in raw_articles:
318                try:
319                    processed_article = self._process_article(
320                        raw_article, source_id, source_config
321                    )
322                    if processed_article and self._save_article(processed_article):
323                        saved_count += 1
324                except Exception as exc:
325                    self._emit_log(
326                        "error",
327                        "collector.article.process_error",
328                        source_id=source_id,
329                        details={
330                            "error": str(exc),
331                            "url": raw_article.get("link")
332                            or raw_article.get("id")
333                            or raw_article.get("url"),
334                        },
335                    )
336                    self.session_stats["errors_encountered"] += 1
337
338            stats["articles_saved"] = saved_count
339            stats["success"] = True
340
341            elapsed = time.time() - start_time
342            self._emit_log(
343                "info",
344                "collector.fetch.completed",
345                source_id=source_id,
346                latency=elapsed,
347                details={
348                    "articles_found": len(raw_articles),
349                    "articles_saved": saved_count,
350                },
351            )
352
353        except requests.RequestException as exc:
354            stats["error_message"] = f"Error de red: {exc}"
355            self._emit_log(
356                "error",
357                "collector.fetch.network_error",
358                source_id=source_id,
359                details={"error": str(exc), "url": source_config.get("url")},
360            )
361
362        except Exception as exc:
363            stats["error_message"] = f"Error inesperado: {exc}"
364            self._emit_log(
365                "error",
366                "collector.fetch.unexpected_error",
367                source_id=source_id,
368                details={"error": str(exc)},
369            )
370
371        finally:
372            stats["processing_time"] = time.time() - start_time
373            self._update_source_stats(source_id, stats)
374            self.session_stats["sources_checked"] += 1
375            self.session_stats["articles_found"] += stats["articles_found"]
376            self.session_stats["articles_saved"] += stats["articles_saved"]
377
378        return stats

Recopila artículos de una fuente RSS específica.

Este método es como enviar a nuestro explorador a una biblioteca específica con instrucciones precisas sobre qué tipo de libros buscar y cómo traerlos de vuelta de manera organizada.

Args: source_id: Identificador único de la fuente source_config: Configuración completa de la fuente

Returns: Diccionario con estadísticas de la recolección

def get_session_stats(self) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
1073    def get_session_stats(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1074        """
1075        Obtiene estadísticas de la sesión actual de recolección.
1076
1077        Este método es como obtener un reporte de actividad de nuestro
1078        explorador después de una expedición completa.
1079        """
1080        current_time = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
1081        session_duration = current_time - self.session_stats["start_time"]
1082
1083        return {
1084            **self.session_stats,
1085            "session_duration_minutes": session_duration.total_seconds() / 60,
1086            "articles_per_minute": self.session_stats["articles_found"]
1087            / max(session_duration.total_seconds() / 60, 1),
1088            "success_rate": (
1089                self.session_stats["articles_saved"]
1090                / max(self.session_stats["articles_found"], 1)
1091            )
1092            * 100,
1093            "end_time": current_time.isoformat(),
1094        }

Obtiene estadísticas de la sesión actual de recolección.

class BaseCollector(abc.ABC): 
 32class BaseCollector(ABC):
 33    """
 34    Clase base abstracta para todos los colectores del sistema.
 35
 36    Esta clase es como el ADN común que comparten todos nuestros colectores:
 37    define qué características esenciales debe tener cada uno, pero permite
 38    que cada implementación específica (RSS, API, etc.) tenga su propia
 39    personalidad y especialización.
 40
 41    Usando el patrón Template Method, proporcionamos una estructura común
 42    mientras permitimos customización específica por tipo de colector.
 43    """
 44
 45    def __init__(self, logger_factory: Optional["NewsCollectorLogger"] = None) -> None:
 46        """Inicialización común para todos los colectores."""
 47
 48        self.collector_type = self.__class__.__name__
 49        self.start_time: Optional[datetime] = None
 50        self.stats = {
 51            "total_sources_processed": 0,
 52            "total_articles_found": 0,
 53            "total_articles_saved": 0,
 54            "total_errors": 0,
 55            "processing_time_seconds": 0,
 56        }
 57
 58        self.logger_factory: "NewsCollectorLogger" = logger_factory or get_logger()
 59        self.module_logger = self.logger_factory.create_module_logger(
 60            f"collectors.{self.collector_type.lower()}"
 61        )
 62        self._active_trace_id: Optional[str] = None
 63        self._active_session_id: Optional[str] = None
 64
 65        self._emit_log(
 66            "info",
 67            "collector.instance.initialized",
 68            details={"collector_type": self.collector_type},
 69        )
 70
 71        # Idempotency tracking for this run
 72        self._job_keys_seen: set[str] = set()
 73
 74    @abstractmethod
 75    def collect_from_source(
 76        self, source_id: str, source_config: Dict[str, Any]
 77    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 78        """
 79        Método abstracto que debe implementar cada colector específico.
 80
 81        Este es el corazón de cada colector: define cómo recopilar información
 82        de una fuente específica. Cada tipo de colector (RSS, API, etc.)
 83        implementará este método según sus necesidades particulares.
 84
 85        Args:
 86            source_id: Identificador único de la fuente
 87            source_config: Configuración completa de la fuente
 88
 89        Returns:
 90            Diccionario con estadísticas de la recolección:
 91            {
 92                'source_id': str,
 93                'success': bool,
 94                'articles_found': int,
 95                'articles_saved': int,
 96                'error_message': Optional[str],
 97                'processing_time': float
 98            }
 99        """
100        pass
101
102    def collect_from_multiple_sources(
103        self,
104        sources_config: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]],
105        *,
106        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
107        trace_id: Optional[str] = None,
108    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
109        """Coordina la recolección de múltiples fuentes de manera estructurada."""
110
111        self._set_runtime_context(session_id=session_id, trace_id=trace_id)
112        self.start_time = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
113
114        self._emit_log(
115            "info",
116            "collector.batch.start",
117            latency=0.0,
118            details={"sources": len(sources_config)},
119        )
120
121        self._reset_stats()
122        source_results: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]] = {}
123
124        for source_id, source_config in sources_config.items():
125            try:
126                self._pre_process_source(source_id, source_config)
127                source_result = self.collect_from_source(source_id, source_config)
128                self._update_global_stats(source_result)
129                self._post_process_source(source_id, source_config, source_result)
130                source_results[source_id] = source_result
131
132                event_name = (
133                    "collector.source.completed"
134                    if source_result.get("success", False)
135                    else "collector.source.failed"
136                )
137                level = "info" if source_result.get("success", False) else "warning"
138                self._emit_log(
139                    level,
140                    event_name,
141                    source_id=source_id,
142                    latency=float(source_result.get("processing_time") or 0.0),
143                    details={
144                        "articles_found": source_result.get("articles_found", 0),
145                        "articles_saved": source_result.get("articles_saved", 0),
146                        "error_message": source_result.get("error_message"),
147                    },
148                )
149
150            except Exception as exc:
151                error_result = {
152                    "source_id": source_id,
153                    "success": False,
154                    "articles_found": 0,
155                    "articles_saved": 0,
156                    "error_message": f"Error inesperado: {exc}",
157                    "processing_time": 0.0,
158                }
159                source_results[source_id] = error_result
160                self.stats["total_errors"] += 1
161
162                self._emit_log(
163                    "error",
164                    "collector.source.exception",
165                    source_id=source_id,
166                    details={"error": str(exc)},
167                )
168
169        end_time = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
170        self.stats["processing_time_seconds"] = (
171            end_time - (self.start_time or end_time)
172        ).total_seconds()
173
174        self._post_process_collection(source_results)
175        final_report = self._generate_collection_report(source_results)
176
177        self._emit_log(
178            "info",
179            "collector.batch.completed",
180            latency=self.stats["processing_time_seconds"],
181            details={
182                "articles_saved": self.stats["total_articles_saved"],
183                "articles_found": self.stats["total_articles_found"],
184                "sources_processed": self.stats["total_sources_processed"],
185                "errors": self.stats["total_errors"],
186            },
187        )
188
189        self._reset_runtime_context()
190        return final_report
191
192    def set_logger_factory(self, logger_factory: "NewsCollectorLogger") -> None:
193        """Actualiza la fábrica de loggers reutilizando el mismo módulo."""
194
195        self.logger_factory = logger_factory
196        self.module_logger = self.logger_factory.create_module_logger(
197            f"collectors.{self.collector_type.lower()}"
198        )
199
200    def _set_runtime_context(
201        self, *, session_id: Optional[str], trace_id: Optional[str]
202    ) -> None:
203        """Asigna contexto transitorio para logs estructurados."""
204
205        self._active_session_id = session_id
206        self._active_trace_id = trace_id
207
208    def _reset_runtime_context(self) -> None:
209        """Limpia el contexto una vez finalizado el batch."""
210
211        self._active_session_id = None
212        self._active_trace_id = None
213
214    def _build_log_payload(
215        self,
216        event: str,
217        *,
218        source_id: Optional[str] = None,
219        article_id: Optional[str] = None,
220        latency: Optional[float] = None,
221        details: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
222        trace_id: Optional[str] = None,
223        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
224    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
225        """Crea un payload consistente para logs estructurados."""
226
227        payload: Dict[str, Any] = {
228            "event": event,
229            "trace_id": trace_id if trace_id is not None else self._active_trace_id,
230            "session_id": (
231                session_id if session_id is not None else self._active_session_id
232            ),
233            "source_id": source_id,
234            "article_id": article_id,
235            "collector_type": self.collector_type,
236            "latency": latency,
237        }
238
239        if details:
240            payload["details"] = details
241
242        return {key: value for key, value in payload.items() if value is not None}
243
244    def _emit_log(
245        self,
246        level: str,
247        event: str,
248        *,
249        source_id: Optional[str] = None,
250        article_id: Optional[str] = None,
251        latency: Optional[float] = None,
252        details: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
253        trace_id: Optional[str] = None,
254        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
255    ) -> None:
256        """Emite logs estructurados garantizando campos de correlación."""
257
258        payload = self._build_log_payload(
259            event,
260            source_id=source_id,
261            article_id=article_id,
262            latency=latency,
263            details=details,
264            trace_id=trace_id,
265            session_id=session_id,
266        )
267
268        log_method = getattr(self.module_logger, level, None)
269        if callable(log_method):
270            log_method(payload)
271        else:  # pragma: no cover - defensive
272            self.module_logger.info(payload)
273
274    def _reset_stats(self):
275        """
276        Resetea las estadísticas para una nueva sesión de recolección.
277        """
278        self.stats = {
279            "total_sources_processed": 0,
280            "total_articles_found": 0,
281            "total_articles_saved": 0,
282            "total_errors": 0,
283            "processing_time_seconds": 0,
284        }
285
286    def _update_global_stats(self, source_result: Dict[str, Any]):
287        """
288        Actualiza las estadísticas globales con el resultado de una fuente.
289
290        Este método es como tener un contador centralizado que lleva registro
291        de cada evento que va sucediendo durante la recolección.
292        """
293        self.stats["total_sources_processed"] += 1
294        self.stats["total_articles_found"] += source_result.get("articles_found", 0)
295        self.stats["total_articles_saved"] += source_result.get("articles_saved", 0)
296
297        if not source_result.get("success", False):
298            self.stats["total_errors"] += 1
299
300    def _generate_collection_report(
301        self, source_results: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]
302    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
303        """
304        Genera un reporte comprehensivo de la sesión de recolección.
305
306        Este reporte es como un informe ejecutivo que resume cada hito que
307        aconteció durante la expedición de recolección de información.
308        """
309        # Calcular métricas derivadas
310        success_rate = 0
311        if self.stats["total_sources_processed"] > 0:
312            successful_sources = sum(1 for r in source_results.values() if r["success"])
313            success_rate = (
314                successful_sources / self.stats["total_sources_processed"]
315            ) * 100
316
317        save_rate = 0
318        if self.stats["total_articles_found"] > 0:
319            save_rate = (
320                self.stats["total_articles_saved"] / self.stats["total_articles_found"]
321            ) * 100
322
323        # Identificar mejores y peores fuentes
324        best_sources = sorted(
325            [
326                (source_id, result)
327                for source_id, result in source_results.items()
328                if result["success"]
329            ],
330            key=lambda x: x[1]["articles_saved"],
331            reverse=True,
332        )[:5]
333
334        failed_sources = [
335            (source_id, result)
336            for source_id, result in source_results.items()
337            if not result["success"]
338        ]
339
340        # Generar reporte final
341        report = {
342            "collection_summary": {
343                "collector_type": self.collector_type,
344                "start_time": self.start_time.isoformat(),
345                "end_time": datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat(),
346                "duration_seconds": self.stats["processing_time_seconds"],
347                "sources_processed": self.stats["total_sources_processed"],
348                "articles_found": self.stats["total_articles_found"],
349                "articles_saved": self.stats["total_articles_saved"],
350                "errors_encountered": self.stats["total_errors"],
351                "success_rate_percent": round(success_rate, 2),
352                "save_rate_percent": round(save_rate, 2),
353            },
354            "source_details": source_results,
355            "top_performers": [
356                {
357                    "source_id": source_id,
358                    "articles_saved": result["articles_saved"],
359                    "articles_found": result["articles_found"],
360                    "efficiency": round(
361                        (result["articles_saved"] / max(result["articles_found"], 1))
362                        * 100,
363                        1,
364                    ),
365                }
366                for source_id, result in best_sources
367            ],
368            "failed_sources": [
369                {"source_id": source_id, "error_message": result["error_message"]}
370                for source_id, result in failed_sources
371            ],
372            "recommendations": self._generate_recommendations(source_results),
373        }
374
375        return report
376
377    # Idempotency helpers
378    # ===================
379    def _make_job_key(self, source_id: str, target: str) -> str:
380        raw = f"{self.collector_type}|{source_id}|{target}"
381        return hashlib.sha256(raw.encode("utf-8")).hexdigest()
382
383    def _is_duplicate_job(self, job_key: str) -> bool:
384        return job_key in self._job_keys_seen
385
386    def _register_job(self, job_key: str) -> None:
387        self._job_keys_seen.add(job_key)
388
389    # Dead-letter queue
390    # =================
391    def _send_to_dlq(
392        self,
393        source_id: str,
394        url: str,
395        reason: str,
396        context: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
397    ) -> Path:
398        ts = datetime.now(timezone.utc).strftime("%Y%m%dT%H%M%SZ")
399        safe_hash = hashlib.sha256(
400            f"{source_id}|{url}|{ts}".encode("utf-8")
401        ).hexdigest()[:12]
402        path = Path(DLQ_DIR) / f"{self.collector_type}_{source_id}_{safe_hash}.json"
403        payload = {
404            "timestamp": ts,
405            "collector": self.collector_type,
406            "source_id": source_id,
407            "url": url,
408            "reason": reason,
409            "context": context or {},
410        }
411        try:
412            path.write_text(
413                json.dumps(payload, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2), encoding="utf-8"
414            )
415        except Exception as exc:
416            # Best-effort DLQ
417            self._emit_log(
418                "error",
419                "collector.dlq.write_failed",
420                source_id=source_id,
421                details={"error": str(exc), "path": str(path)},
422            )
423        return path
424
425    def _generate_recommendations(
426        self, source_results: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]
427    ) -> List[str]:
428        """
429        Genera recomendaciones basadas en los resultados de la recolección.
430
431        Este método es como tener un analista experto que revisa todos los
432        resultados y sugiere mejoras para futuras recolecciones.
433        """
434        recommendations = []
435
436        # Analizar fuentes que fallan consistentemente
437        failed_sources = [s for s, r in source_results.items() if not r["success"]]
438        if len(failed_sources) > len(source_results) * 0.2:  # Más del 20% falló
439            recommendations.append(
440                f"🔧 Revisar configuración de fuentes - {len(failed_sources)} fuentes fallaron"
441            )
442
443        # Analizar eficiencia de guardado
444        total_found = sum(r["articles_found"] for r in source_results.values())
445        total_saved = sum(r["articles_saved"] for r in source_results.values())
446
447        if (
448            total_found > 0 and (total_saved / total_found) < 0.5
449        ):  # Menos del 50% guardado
450            recommendations.append(
451                "📊 Baja tasa de guardado - revisar criterios de filtrado y deduplicación"
452            )
453
454        # Analizar fuentes sin nuevos artículos
455        empty_sources = [
456            s
457            for s, r in source_results.items()
458            if r["success"] and r["articles_found"] == 0
459        ]
460        if empty_sources:
461            recommendations.append(
462                f"📭 {len(empty_sources)} fuentes sin artículos nuevos - considerar ajustar frecuencia"
463            )
464
465        # Analizar tiempo de procesamiento
466        if self.stats["processing_time_seconds"] > 300:  # Más de 5 minutos
467            recommendations.append(
468                "⏱️ Tiempo de procesamiento alto - considerar paralelización o optimización"
469            )
470
471        return recommendations
472

502    # Métodos de utilidad comunes
503    # ===========================
504
505    def get_stats(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
506        """
507        Obtiene las estadísticas actuales del colector.
508        """
509        return self.stats.copy()
510
511    def is_healthy(self) -> bool:
512        """
513        Determina si el colector está en estado saludable.
514
515        Un colector se considera saludable si no ha tenido demasiados errores
516        y está procesando fuentes de manera efectiva.
517        """
518        if self.stats["total_sources_processed"] == 0:
519            return True  # No ha procesado nada aún
520
521        error_rate = self.stats["total_errors"] / self.stats["total_sources_processed"]
522        return error_rate < 0.3  # Menos del 30% de errores
523
524    def get_performance_metrics(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
525        """
526        Calcula métricas de performance del colector.
527
528        Estas métricas son útiles para monitoreo y optimización del sistema.
529        """
530        if self.stats["processing_time_seconds"] == 0:
531            return {}
532
533        return {
534            "sources_per_minute": (
535                self.stats["total_sources_processed"]
536                / max(self.stats["processing_time_seconds"] / 60, 1)
537            ),
538            "articles_per_minute": (
539                self.stats["total_articles_found"]
540                / max(self.stats["processing_time_seconds"] / 60, 1)
541            ),
542            "success_rate": (
543                (self.stats["total_sources_processed"] - self.stats["total_errors"])
544                / max(self.stats["total_sources_processed"], 1)
545            ),
546            "efficiency_rate": (
547                self.stats["total_articles_saved"]
548                / max(self.stats["total_articles_found"], 1)
549            ),
550        }

120
121        self._reset_stats()
122        source_results: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]] = {}
123
124        for source_id, source_config in sources_config.items():
125            try:
126                self._pre_process_source(source_id, source_config)
127                source_result = self.collect_from_source(source_id, source_config)
128                self._update_global_stats(source_result)
129                self._post_process_source(source_id, source_config, source_result)
130                source_results[source_id] = source_result
131
132                event_name = (
133                    "collector.source.completed"
134                    if source_result.get("success", False)
135                    else "collector.source.failed"
136                )
137                level = "info" if source_result.get("success", False) else "warning"
138                self._emit_log(
139                    level,
140                    event_name,
141                    source_id=source_id,
142                    latency=float(source_result.get("processing_time") or 0.0),
143                    details={
144                        "articles_found": source_result.get("articles_found", 0),
145                        "articles_saved": source_result.get("articles_saved", 0),
146                        "error_message": source_result.get("error_message"),
147                    },
148                )
149
150            except Exception as exc:
151                error_result = {
152                    "source_id": source_id,
153                    "success": False,
154                    "articles_found": 0,
155                    "articles_saved": 0,
156                    "error_message": f"Error inesperado: {exc}",
157                    "processing_time": 0.0,
158                }
159                source_results[source_id] = error_result
160                self.stats["total_errors"] += 1
161
162                self._emit_log(
163                    "error",
164                    "collector.source.exception",
165                    source_id=source_id,
166                    details={"error": str(exc)},
167                )
168
169        end_time = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
170        self.stats["processing_time_seconds"] = (
171            end_time - (self.start_time or end_time)
172        ).total_seconds()
173
174        self._post_process_collection(source_results)
175        final_report = self._generate_collection_report(source_results)
176
177        self._emit_log(
178            "info",
179            "collector.batch.completed",
180            latency=self.stats["processing_time_seconds"],
181            details={
182                "articles_saved": self.stats["total_articles_saved"],
183                "articles_found": self.stats["total_articles_found"],
184                "sources_processed": self.stats["total_sources_processed"],
185                "errors": self.stats["total_errors"],
186            },
187        )
188
189        self._reset_runtime_context()
190        return final_report

Coordina la recolección de múltiples fuentes de manera estructurada.

def is_healthy(self) -> bool: 
511    def is_healthy(self) -> bool:
512        """
513        Determina si el colector está en estado saludable.
514
515        Un colector se considera saludable si no ha tenido demasiados errores
516        y está procesando fuentes de manera efectiva.
517        """
518        if self.stats["total_sources_processed"] == 0:
519            return True  # No ha procesado nada aún
520
521        error_rate = self.stats["total_errors"] / self.stats["total_sources_processed"]
522        return error_rate < 0.3  # Menos del 30% de errores

Determina si el colector está en estado saludable.

Un colector se considera saludable si no ha tenido demasiados errores y está procesando fuentes de manera efectiva.

def get_performance_metrics(self) -> Dict[str, float]: 
524    def get_performance_metrics(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
525        """
526        Calcula métricas de performance del colector.
527
528        Estas métricas son útiles para monitoreo y optimización del sistema.
529        """
530        if self.stats["processing_time_seconds"] == 0:
531            return {}
532
533        return {
534            "sources_per_minute": (
535                self.stats["total_sources_processed"]
536                / max(self.stats["processing_time_seconds"] / 60, 1)
537            ),
538            "articles_per_minute": (
539                self.stats["total_articles_found"]
540                / max(self.stats["processing_time_seconds"] / 60, 1)
541            ),
542            "success_rate": (
543                (self.stats["total_sources_processed"] - self.stats["total_errors"])
544                / max(self.stats["total_sources_processed"], 1)
545            ),
546            "efficiency_rate": (
547                self.stats["total_articles_saved"]
548                / max(self.stats["total_articles_found"], 1)
549            ),
550        }

Calcula métricas de performance del colector.
