@contextmanager
def get_session(self): 
293    @contextmanager
294    def get_session(self):
295        """
296        Context manager para manejar sesiones de base de datos de manera segura.
297
298        Esto es como tener un sistema de préstamo de libros que automáticamente
299        registra cuando tomas un libro y cuando lo devuelves, asegurándose
300        de que cada estantería permanezca en orden.
301
302        Uso:
303            with db_manager.get_session() as session:
304                # Hacer operaciones con la base de datos
305                article = session.query(Article).first()
306        """
307        session = self.SessionLocal()
308        try:
309            yield session
310            session.commit()
311        except Exception as e:
312            session.rollback()
313            logger.error(f"Error en operación de base de datos: {e}")
314            raise
315        finally:
316            session.close()

Context manager para manejar sesiones de base de datos de manera segura.

def save_article( self, article_data: Union[src.contracts.collector.CollectorArticleModel, Dict[str, Any]]) -> Optional[src.storage.models.Article]: 
322    def save_article(
323        self, article_data: CollectorArticleModel | Dict[str, Any]
324    ) -> Optional[Article]:
325        """
326        Guarda un nuevo artículo en la base de datos.
327
328        Esta función es como tener un bibliotecario que verifica que no
329        tengas ya el mismo libro antes de agregarlo a la colección,
330        y que lo catalogue apropiadamente.
331
332        Args:
333            article_data: Instancia validada del contrato del colector o un
334                diccionario compatible con el esquema.
335
336        Returns:
337            El artículo guardado o None si ya existía
338        """
339        if isinstance(article_data, CollectorArticleModel):
340            model = article_data
341        else:
342            try:
343                model = CollectorArticleModel.model_validate(article_data)
344            except ValidationError as exc:
345                raise ValueError(f"Invalid collector payload: {exc}") from exc
346
347        payload = model.model_dump_for_storage()
348        normalized_published = self._ensure_timezone(payload.get("published_date"))
349        if normalized_published:
350            payload["published_date"] = normalized_published
351
352        with self.get_session() as session:
353            try:
354                # Verificar si ya existe por URL
355                existing = session.query(Article).filter_by(url=payload["url"]).first()
356                if existing:
357                    logger.debug(f"Artículo ya existe: {payload['url']}")
358                    return None
359
360                norm_title, norm_summary, normalized_text = normalize_article_text(
361                    payload.get("title", ""),
362                    payload.get("summary", ""),
363                )
364                normalized_basis = normalized_text or payload["url"]
365                content_hash = sha256_hex(normalized_basis)
366
367                # Verificar duplicados exactos por hash
368                existing_by_content = (
369                    session.query(Article).filter_by(content_hash=content_hash).first()
370                )
371                if existing_by_content:
372                    logger.debug(
373                        f"Contenido duplicado encontrado para: {payload['title']}"
374                    )
375                    return None
376
377                simhash_value = self._simhash_normalize_unsigned(
378                    simhash64(normalized_basis)
379                )
380                simhash_prefix = self._simhash_prefix_value(simhash_value)
381                cluster_id, confidence = self._assign_cluster(
382                    session, simhash_value, payload.get("published_date")
383                )
384
385                article_metadata = payload.get("article_metadata", {}) or {}
386                article_metadata.setdefault("normalized_title", norm_title)
387                article_metadata.setdefault("normalized_summary", norm_summary)
388                article_metadata.setdefault(
389                    "original_url",
390                    payload.get("original_url", payload["url"]),
391                )
392
393                # Crear nuevo artículo
394                article = Article(
395                    url=payload["url"],
396                    content_hash=content_hash,
397                    simhash=self._simhash_to_storage(simhash_value),
398                    simhash_prefix=simhash_prefix,
399                    title=payload["title"],
400                    summary=payload.get("summary"),
401                    content=payload.get("content"),
402                    source_id=payload["source_id"],
403                    source_name=payload["source_name"],
404                    published_date=payload.get("published_date"),
405                    published_tz_offset_minutes=payload.get(
406                        "published_tz_offset_minutes"
407                    ),
408                    published_tz_name=payload.get("published_tz_name"),
409                    authors=payload.get("authors"),
410                    category=payload["category"],
411                    doi=payload.get("doi"),
412                    journal=payload.get("journal"),
413                    is_preprint=payload.get("is_preprint", False),
414                    language=payload.get("language", "en"),
415                    processing_status=PENDING_STATUS,
416                    article_metadata=article_metadata,
417                    cluster_id=cluster_id,
418                    duplication_confidence=confidence,
419                )
420
421                session.add(article)
422                session.flush()  # Para obtener el ID sin hacer commit
423
424                # Revalidar cluster para evitar outliers
425                if cluster_id:
426                    self._revalidate_cluster(session, cluster_id)
427
428                logger.info(f"✅ Artículo guardado: {article.title[:50]}...")
429                return article
430
431            except IntegrityError as e:
432                logger.warning(f"Intento de guardar artículo duplicado: {e}")
433                return None
434            except Exception as e:
435                logger.error(f"Error guardando artículo: {e}")
436                raise

Guarda un nuevo artículo en la base de datos.

def get_articles_by_score( self, limit: int = 10, min_score: float = 0.0) -> List[src.storage.models.Article]: 
632    def get_articles_by_score(
633        self, limit: int = 10, min_score: float = 0.0
634    ) -> List[Article]:
635        """
636        Obtiene los artículos mejor rankeados.
637
638        Es como pedirle al bibliotecario que te traiga los mejores libros
639        de la colección según las reseñas y popularidad.
640        """
641        with self.get_session() as session:
642            return (
643                session.query(Article)
644                .filter(Article.final_score >= min_score)
645                .filter(Article.processing_status == "completed")
646                .order_by(desc(Article.final_score), Article.collected_date.desc())
647                .limit(limit)
648                .all()
649            )

def update_article_score( self, article_id: int, score_data: Union[src.contracts.scoring.ScoringRequestModel, Dict[str, Any]]) -> bool: 
688    def update_article_score(
689        self, article_id: int, score_data: ScoringRequestModel | Dict[str, Any]
690    ) -> bool:
691        """
692        Actualiza el score de un artículo y registra el cálculo en ScoreLog.
693
694        Es como actualizar la calificación de un libro y mantener un registro
695        de por qué recibió esa calificación.
696        """
697        if isinstance(score_data, ScoringRequestModel):
698            score_model = score_data
699        else:
700            try:
701                score_model = ScoringRequestModel.model_validate(score_data)
702            except ValidationError as exc:
703                raise ValueError(
704                    f"Invalid scoring payload for article {article_id}: {exc}"
705                ) from exc
706
707        payload = score_model.model_dump_for_storage()
708        components_model = score_model.components
709
710        with self.get_session() as session:
711            try:
712                article = session.query(Article).filter_by(id=article_id).first()
713                if not article:
714                    logger.warning(
715                        f"Artículo no encontrado para score update: {article_id}"
716                    )
717                    return False
718
719                # Actualizar scores en el artículo
720                article.final_score = payload["final_score"]
721                article.score_components = payload.get("components", {})
722                article.processing_status = "completed"
723
724                # Crear registro en ScoreLog
725                score_log = ScoreLog(
726                    article_id=article_id,
727                    score_version=payload.get("version", "1.0"),
728                    source_credibility_score=payload["components"].get(
729                        "source_credibility"
730                    ),
731                    recency_score=payload["components"].get("recency"),
732                    content_quality_score=payload["components"].get("content_quality"),
733                    engagement_score=components_model.get_engagement_value(),
734                    final_score=payload["final_score"],
735                    score_explanation=payload.get("explanation", {}),
736                    algorithm_weights=payload.get("weights", {}),
737                )
738
739                session.add(score_log)
740
741                logger.info(
742                    f"✅ Score actualizado para artículo {article_id}: {payload['final_score']}"
743                )
744                return True
745
746            except Exception as e:
747                logger.error(f"Error actualizando score: {e}")
748                return False

def initialize_sources(self, sources_config: Dict[str, Dict]) -> None: 
754    def initialize_sources(self, sources_config: Dict[str, Dict]) -> None:
755        """
756        Inicializa o actualiza la información de fuentes en la base de datos.
757
758        Es como crear fichas para cada uno de nuestros proveedores de libros,
759        con toda su información de contacto y estadísticas.
760        """
761        with self.get_session() as session:
762            for source_id, source_config in sources_config.items():
763                existing_source = session.query(Source).filter_by(id=source_id).first()
764
765                if existing_source:
766                    # Actualizar fuente existente
767                    existing_source.name = source_config["name"]
768                    existing_source.url = source_config["url"]
769                    existing_source.credibility_score = source_config[
770                        "credibility_score"
771                    ]
772                    existing_source.category = source_config["category"]
773                    existing_source.update_frequency = source_config.get(
774                        "update_frequency"
775                    )
776                    if source_config.get("etag"):
777                        existing_source.feed_etag = source_config["etag"]
778                    if source_config.get("last_modified"):
779                        existing_source.feed_last_modified = source_config[
780                            "last_modified"
781                        ]
782                else:
783                    # Crear nueva fuente
784                    new_source = Source(
785                        id=source_id,
786                        name=source_config["name"],
787                        url=source_config["url"],
788                        credibility_score=source_config["credibility_score"],
789                        category=source_config["category"],
790                        update_frequency=source_config.get("update_frequency"),
791                        is_active=True,
792                        feed_etag=source_config.get("etag"),
793                        feed_last_modified=source_config.get("last_modified"),
794                    )
795                    session.add(new_source)
796
797            logger.info(f"✅ {len(sources_config)} fuentes inicializadas/actualizadas")

def update_source_feed_metadata( self, source_id: str, *, etag: Optional[str] = None, last_modified: Optional[str] = None) -> None: 
811    def update_source_feed_metadata(
812        self,
813        source_id: str,
814        *,
815        etag: Optional[str] = None,
816        last_modified: Optional[str] = None,
817    ) -> None:
818        """Actualiza los encabezados HTTP cacheados después de un fetch."""
819
820        if etag is None and last_modified is None:
821            return
822
823        with self.get_session() as session:
824            source = session.query(Source).filter_by(id=source_id).first()
825            if not source:
826                return
827            if etag is not None:
828                source.feed_etag = etag
829            if last_modified is not None:
830                source.feed_last_modified = last_modified

Actualiza los encabezados HTTP cacheados después de un fetch.

def update_source_stats(self, source_id: str, stats: Dict[str, Any]) -> None: 
832    def update_source_stats(self, source_id: str, stats: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
833        """
834        Actualiza las estadísticas de una fuente después de una recolección.
835
836        Como actualizar el expediente de un proveedor con información sobre
837        su último envío de libros.
838        """
839        with self.get_session() as session:
840            source = session.query(Source).filter_by(id=source_id).first()
841            if source:
842                source.last_checked = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
843                if stats.get("success", False):
844                    source.last_successful_check = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
845                    if stats.get("articles_found", 0) > 0:
846                        source.last_article_found = datetime.now(timezone.utc)
847                        source.total_articles_collected += stats["articles_found"]
848                    source.consecutive_failures = 0
849                else:
850                    source.consecutive_failures += 1
851                    source.error_message = stats.get("error_message")
852
853                # Actualizar tasa de éxito
854                if source.total_articles_collected > 0:
855                    success_rate = 1.0 - (
856                        source.consecutive_failures
857                        / max(source.total_articles_collected, 1)
858                    )
859                    source.success_rate = max(0.0, success_rate)

Actualiza las estadísticas de una fuente después de una recolección.

Como actualizar el expediente de un proveedor con información sobre su último envío de libros.

def get_daily_stats(self, date: datetime.datetime = None) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
865    def get_daily_stats(self, date: datetime = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
866        """
867        Obtiene estadísticas diarias del sistema.
868
869        Como obtener un reporte diario de actividad de la biblioteca:
870        cuántos libros llegaron, cuáles fueron los más populares, etc.
871        """
872        if not date:
873            date = datetime.now(timezone.utc).date()
874
875        start_date = datetime.combine(date, datetime.min.time()).replace(
876            tzinfo=timezone.utc
877        )
878        end_date = start_date + timedelta(days=1)
879
880        with self.get_session() as session:
881            # Artículos recolectados hoy
882            articles_collected = (
883                session.query(func.count(Article.id))
884                .filter(Article.collected_date >= start_date)
885                .filter(Article.collected_date < end_date)
886                .scalar()
887            )
888
889            # Artículos procesados hoy
890            articles_processed = (
891                session.query(func.count(Article.id))
892                .filter(Article.collected_date >= start_date)
893                .filter(Article.collected_date < end_date)
894                .filter(Article.processing_status == "completed")
895                .scalar()
896            )
897
898            # Score promedio de artículos de hoy
899            avg_score = (
900                session.query(func.avg(Article.final_score))
901                .filter(Article.collected_date >= start_date)
902                .filter(Article.collected_date < end_date)
903                .filter(Article.final_score.isnot(None))
904                .scalar()
905            )
906
907            # Distribución por categorías
908            category_distribution = dict(
909                session.query(Article.category, func.count(Article.id))
910                .filter(Article.collected_date >= start_date)
911                .filter(Article.collected_date < end_date)
912                .group_by(Article.category)
913                .all()
914            )
915
916            return {
917                "date": date.isoformat(),
918                "articles_collected": articles_collected or 0,
919                "articles_processed": articles_processed or 0,
920                "processing_rate": (articles_processed / max(articles_collected, 1))
921                * 100,
922                "average_score": round(avg_score or 0.0, 3),
923                "category_distribution": category_distribution,
924            }

Obtiene estadísticas diarias del sistema.

Como obtener un reporte diario de actividad de la biblioteca: cuántos libros llegaron, cuáles fueron los más populares, etc.

def get_top_sources_performance(self, days_back: int = 30) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]: 
926    def get_top_sources_performance(self, days_back: int = 30) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
927        """
928        Obtiene el performance de las mejores fuentes en los últimos días.
929
930        Como obtener un ranking de cuáles proveedores han traído
931        los mejores libros recientemente.
932        """
933        cutoff_date = datetime.now(timezone.utc) - timedelta(days=days_back)
934
935        with self.get_session() as session:
936            article_agg = (
937                session.query(
938                    Article.source_id.label("source_id"),
939                    func.count(Article.id).label("article_count"),
940                    func.avg(Article.final_score).label("avg_score"),
941                    func.max(Article.final_score).label("max_score"),
942                )
943                .filter(Article.processing_status == "completed")
944                .filter(Article.collected_date >= cutoff_date)
945                .group_by(Article.source_id)
946                .subquery()
947            )
948
949            results = (
950                session.query(
951                    Source.id,
952                    Source.name,
953                    article_agg.c.article_count,
954                    article_agg.c.avg_score,
955                    article_agg.c.max_score,
956                )
957                .join(article_agg, article_agg.c.source_id == Source.id)
958                .order_by(desc(article_agg.c.avg_score))
959                .all()
960            )
961
962            return [
963                {
964                    "source_id": r.id,
965                    "source_name": r.name,
966                    "article_count": r.article_count,
967                    "average_score": round(r.avg_score or 0.0, 3),
968                    "max_score": round(r.max_score or 0.0, 3),
969                }
970                for r in results
971            ]

Obtiene el performance de las mejores fuentes en los últimos días.

Como obtener un ranking de cuáles proveedores han traído los mejores libros recientemente.

def cleanup_old_data(self, days_to_keep: int = 90) -> Dict[str, int]: 
 977    def cleanup_old_data(self, days_to_keep: int = 90) -> Dict[str, int]:
 978        """
 979        Limpia datos antiguos para mantener la base de datos eficiente.
 980
 981        Como hacer una limpieza periódica de la biblioteca, archivando
 982        materiales muy antiguos que ya no son relevantes.
 983        """
 984        cutoff_date = datetime.now(timezone.utc) - timedelta(days=days_to_keep)
 985
 986        with self.get_session() as session:
 987            deleted_articles = (
 988                session.query(Article)
 989                .filter(Article.collected_date < cutoff_date)
 990                .filter(Article.final_score < 0.3)
 991                .delete()
 992            )
 993
 994            # Eliminar logs de score muy antiguos
 995            deleted_logs = (
 996                session.query(ScoreLog)
 997                .filter(ScoreLog.calculated_at < cutoff_date)
 998                .delete()
 999            )
1000
1001            logger.info(
1002                f"🧹 Limpieza completada: {deleted_articles} artículos, {deleted_logs} logs eliminados"
1003            )
1004
1005            return {
1006                "deleted_articles": deleted_articles,
1007                "deleted_score_logs": deleted_logs,
1008                "cutoff_date": cutoff_date.isoformat(),
1009            }

def get_health_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
1011    def get_health_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1012        """
1013        Obtiene el estado de salud general del sistema de base de datos.
1014
1015        Como hacer un chequeo médico completo de nuestra biblioteca digital.
1016        """
1017        with self.get_session() as session:
1018            total_articles = session.query(func.count(Article.id)).scalar()
1019            pending_articles = (
1020                session.query(func.count(Article.id))
1021                .filter(Article.processing_status == PENDING_STATUS)
1022                .scalar()
1023            )
1024
1025            recent_articles = (
1026                session.query(func.count(Article.id))
1027                .filter(
1028                    Article.collected_date
1029                    >= datetime.now(timezone.utc) - timedelta(days=1)
1030                )
1031                .scalar()
1032            )
1033
1034            active_sources = (
1035                session.query(func.count(Source.id))
1036                .filter(Source.is_active.is_(True))
1037                .scalar()
1038            )
1039
1040            failed_sources = (
1041                session.query(func.count(Source.id))
1042                .filter(Source.consecutive_failures > 3)
1043                .scalar()
1044            )
1045
1046            return {
1047                "total_articles": total_articles,
1048                "pending_processing": pending_articles,
1049                "articles_last_24h": recent_articles,
1050                "active_sources": active_sources,
1051                "failed_sources": failed_sources,
1052                "database_type": self.config["type"],
1053                "status": (
1054                    "healthy"
1055                    if failed_sources == 0 and pending_articles < 100
1056                    else "warning"
1057                ),
1058            }

def create_app( database_manager: Optional[DatabaseManager] = None) -> fastapi.applications.FastAPI: 
205def create_app(database_manager: Optional[DatabaseManager] = None) -> FastAPI:
206    """Create a configured FastAPI application."""
207
208    db_manager = database_manager or get_database_manager()
209    app = FastAPI(title="Noticiencias API", version="1.0.0")
210
211    def get_params(
212        source: Optional[List[str]] = Query(None, alias="source"),
213        topic: Optional[List[str]] = Query(None, alias="topic"),
214        date_from: Optional[str] = Query(None, alias="date_from"),
215        date_to: Optional[str] = Query(None, alias="date_to"),
216        page_size: int = Query(20, alias="page_size"),
217        cursor: Optional[str] = Query(None, alias="cursor"),
218    ) -> ArticleListParams:
219        return ArticleListParams(
220            source=source,
221            topic=topic,
222            date_from=date_from,
223            date_to=date_to,
224            page_size=page_size,
225            cursor=cursor,
226        )
227
228    def get_db() -> DatabaseManager:
229        return db_manager
230
231    @app.get("/healthz")
232    def health_probe(manager: DatabaseManager = Depends(get_db)) -> Dict[str, Any]:
233        status = manager.get_health_status()
234        return {
235            "status": "ok" if status.get("status") == "healthy" else "degraded",
236            "details": status,
237        }
238
239    @app.get("/readyz")
240    def readiness_probe(manager: DatabaseManager = Depends(get_db)) -> Dict[str, Any]:
241        try:
242            with manager.get_session() as session:
243                session.query(func.count(Article.id)).scalar()
244        except Exception as exc:  # pragma: no cover - defensive branch
245            raise HTTPException(status_code=503, detail="database unavailable") from exc
246        return {"status": "ready"}
247
248    @app.get("/v1/articles", response_model=ArticlesEnvelope)
249    def list_ranked_articles(
250        params: ArticleListParams = Depends(get_params),
251        manager: DatabaseManager = Depends(get_db),
252    ) -> ArticlesEnvelope:
253        score_column = func.coalesce(Article.final_score, 0.0)
254        session: Session = manager.SessionLocal()  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
255        try:
256            latest_log_subquery = (
257                session.query(
258                    ScoreLog.article_id.label("article_id"),
259                    func.max(ScoreLog.calculated_at).label("latest_calculated"),
260                )
261                .group_by(ScoreLog.article_id)
262                .subquery()
263            )
264
265            score_log_alias = aliased(ScoreLog)
266
267            query = (
268                session.query(Article, score_log_alias)
269                .outerjoin(
270                    latest_log_subquery,
271                    latest_log_subquery.c.article_id == Article.id,
272                )
273                .outerjoin(
274                    score_log_alias,
275                    and_(
276                        score_log_alias.article_id == Article.id,
277                        score_log_alias.calculated_at
278                        == latest_log_subquery.c.latest_calculated,
279                    ),
280                )
281                .filter(Article.processing_status == "completed")
282            )
283
284            if params.source:
285                query = query.filter(Article.source_id.in_(params.source))
286
287            if params.date_from:
288                query = query.filter(Article.published_date >= params.date_from)
289
290            if params.date_to:
291                query = query.filter(Article.published_date <= params.date_to)
292
293            query = _apply_topic_filters(query, params.topic or [])
294
295            if params.cursor:
296                cursor_score, cursor_collected, cursor_id = _decode_cursor(
297                    params.cursor
298                )
299                query = query.filter(
300                    or_(
301                        score_column < cursor_score,
302                        and_(
303                            score_column == cursor_score,
304                            Article.collected_date < cursor_collected,
305                        ),
306                        and_(
307                            score_column == cursor_score,
308                            Article.collected_date == cursor_collected,
309                            Article.id < cursor_id,
310                        ),
311                    )
312                )
313
314            query = query.order_by(
315                score_column.desc(),
316                Article.collected_date.desc(),
317                Article.id.desc(),
318            )
319
320            records: List[Tuple[Article, Optional[ScoreLog]]] = query.limit(
321                params.page_size + 1
322            ).all()
323
324            has_more = len(records) > params.page_size
325            if has_more:
326                records = records[: params.page_size]
327
328            payload = [_build_article_payload(article, log) for article, log in records]
329            next_cursor = _encode_cursor(records[-1][0]) if has_more else None
330
331            return ArticlesEnvelope(
332                data=[ArticleResponse(**item) for item in payload],
333                pagination=PaginationResponse(
334                    next_cursor=next_cursor,
335                    has_more=has_more,
336                    page_size=params.page_size,
337                    returned=len(payload),
338                ),
339                filters={
340                    "source": params.source or [],
341                    "topic": params.topic or [],
342                    "date_from": (
343                        params.date_from.isoformat() if params.date_from else None
344                    ),
345                    "date_to": params.date_to.isoformat() if params.date_to else None,
346                },
347                meta={"generated_at": datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat()},
348            )
349        finally:
350            session.close()
351
352    return app

Create a configured FastAPI application.
